gurmukhi: mMqR ibcwr krXo duhhM iml mwr frY ieh ko mq rwjw ] nMdih ky Gir Awie ho fwr kY Twt iehI mn mY iqn swjw ]
transliteration: Mantra Bichaar Daryo Duh-han Mil Maar Daari Eh Ko Mat Raajaa|| Nandah(i) Aae Ho Daar Kai Thaat Ehiman Mai Tin Saajaa||
translation: Both of them thought that the king may not also kill this son, they decided to leave him in the house of Nand;

gurmukhi: kwn khXo mn mY n fro qum jwhu inSMk bjwvq bwjw ] mwXw kI KYNc knwq leI Dir bwlk saUrB Awp ibrwjw ]63]
transliteration: Kaan Kahyo Man Mai Na Daro Toum Jaahu Nishank Bajaavat Baajaa|| Maayaa Kikhainch Kanaat Laidhar(i) Baalak Saoorabh Aap Biraajaa||62||
translation: Krishna said, “Do not be fearful and go without any suspicion,” saying this Krishna spread his deceptive show (Yoga-maya) in all the four directions and sat himself in the form of a beautiful child.63.

gurmukhi: kiRSn jbY iqn giH BXo bwsdyv ieh kIn ] ds hjwr gweI BlI mnY mns kir dIn ]64]
transliteration: Krishan Jabai Tin Grih Bhayo Baasdev Eh Keen|| Das Hajaar Gadibhalimanai Manas Kar(i) Deen||64||
translation: On the birth of Krishna, Vasudev, in his mind, gave in charity ten thousand cows for the protection of Krishna.64.

gurmukhi: CUit ikvwr gey Gir ky dir ky niRp ky brky clqy ] hrKy srKy bsdyvih ky pg jwie CuXo jmunw jl qy ]
transliteration: Chhodhttee Kivaar Gad Ghar(i) Ke Dar(i) Ke Nrip Ke Barke Chalte|| Harkhe Sarkhe Basdebvah(i) Ke Pag Jaae Chhuyo Jamounnda Jal Te||
translation: When Vasudev started, the doors of the house opened, his feet began to move further and went to enter Yamuna; the water of Yamuna came forward to see Krishna;

gurmukhi: hir dyKn kO hir Aau bFky hir daur gey qn ky bl qy ] kwj iehI doaU gey ju iKJy bhu pwpn kI mlqy ]65]
transliteration: Har(i) Dekhan Kau Har(i) Au Badh-ke Har(i) Daur Gad Tan Ke Bal Te|| Kaaj Ehidooo Gad Ju Khijhe Bahu Paapan Kimalte||65||
translation: Sheshanaga powerfully ran forward, he spread his hoods and waved them like fly-whisk and alongwith it the waters of Yamuna and Sheshanaga both conveyed to Krishna about the increasing dirt of sin in the world.65.

gurmukhi: kiRSn jbY cVqI krI PyirE mwXw jwl ] Asur ijqy caukI huqy soie gey qqkwl ]66]
transliteration: Krishan Jabai Chadtipherio Maayaa Jaal|| Asur Jite Chaoukihoute Soe Gad Tatkaal||66||
translation: When Vasudev began to walk taking Krishna with him, Krishna spread his deceptive show (maya), on account of which the demons, who were there as watchmen went to sleep.66.

gurmukhi: kMsih ky fr qy bsdyv su pwie jbY jmnw miD Twno ] mwn kY pRIq pRwqn ko jl pwien Bytn kwj auTwno ]
transliteration: Kansah(i) Ke Dar Te Basdev Su Paae Jabai Jamnaa Madh(i) Thaano|| Maan Kai Preet Puraatan Ko Jal Paain Bhetan Kaaj Outhaano||
translation: Because of the fear of Kansa, when Vasudev put his feet in Yamuna it surged up to touch the feet of Krishna;

gurmukhi: qw Cib ko js aUc mhw kib ky Apny mn mY phcwno ] kwnH ko jwn ikDo piq hY iehkY jmnw iqh Bytq mwno ]67]
transliteration: Taa Chhab(i) Ko Jas Ouch Mahaa Kahi Ke Apne Man Mai Pahchaano|| Kaahn Ko Jaan Kidho Pat(i) Hai Ihkai Jamnaa Tih Bhetat Maano||67||
translation: Recognising in its mind some old affection; the poet felt thus about the high praise of that elegance that considering Krishna her Lord, Yamuna rose up to touch his feet.67.
